channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Israel killed my sister twice': Woman, who survived October 7 massacre, dies by suicide
item.description: Shirel Golan, a 22-year-old survivor of the Nova music festival massacre, took her own life on her birthday after struggling with PTSD for a year. Despite her family's efforts, they blamed the state for failing to provide proper support. Golan's brother passionately accused the state of neglecting her mental health needs, urging immediate action to prevent more tragedies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Israel finds millions in cash, gold in Hezbollah’s ‘secret’ bunker; see video
item.description: Israel's military has uncovered cash and gold worth hundreds of millions of dollars in a bunker beneath Beirut's Al-Sahel Hospital, allegedly built by Hezbollah's former leader. Despite these findings, Israel will not target the hospital, instead focusing on Hezbollah’s financial assets. Lebanese officials dispute these claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Exonerated Central Park Five file defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump
item.description: The Exonerated Five, wrongly convicted in 1989 for a Central Park assault, filed a defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump for false statements made during a debate. Trump incorrectly claimed they killed someone and pleaded guilty. The lawsuit seeks damages for the harm caused, with their attorney stressing the pursuit of justice, not political motives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will Hamas get a new chief after Yahya Sinwar's death? Here's what reports suggest
item.description: Following the death of Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar by Israeli forces, the group opts for a five-member ruling committee based in Doha instead of appointing a single successor. This interim committee, formed after political chief Ismail Haniyeh's assassination, will lead the movement until new internal elections scheduled for March.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Teen taken into custody after five family members shot dead in Washington home
item.description: A teenager has been detained after a tragic shooting in Fall City, Washington, left five people dead inside a home. The incident occurred around 5 am, resulting in the deaths of two adults and three teenagers. Another injured teen was taken to a Seattle hospital. Authorities have determined there is no ongoing threat to the community.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Moldova secures path toward EU membership in razor-thin vote
South Korea calls for pullout of North troops 'in Russia'
Bangladesh president in interim government's crosshairs over denial of Hasina quitting
Cubans struggle with an extended power outage & a tropical storm
Blinken set to make another push to defuse conflicts in West Asia
Report: Israel has given US its demands for ending war in Lebanon
Iran complains to UN about Israeli threats
Israel busts spy ring acting for Iran
Israel says it 'eliminated' Hezbollah finance chief in Syria
item.description: The Israeli military announced it eliminated a Hezbollah commander overseeing the group’s finances in Syria and intensified strikes on Hezbollah’s financial infrastructure in Lebanon. This follows the killing of the unit’s former leader and targeted financial institutions accused of funding military activities to halt Hezbollah’s capacity and support of Hamas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel strikes Hezbollah-affiliated financial branches across Lebanon
item.description: The Israeli military launched air strikes targeting Al-Qard al-Hasan branches in Lebanon, linked to Hezbollah, to disrupt their financial operations and weaken support. This escalation aims to impede Hezbollah’s activities by hitting its financial network, impacting their ability to function amid Lebanon's ongoing crisis.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni and Euan Ward

item.title: Olivia Nuzzi leaves New York Magazine over secret relationship with Kennedy Jr
item.description: ​"Nevertheless, the magazine and Nuzzi agreed that the best course forward is to part ways. Nuzzi is a uniquely talented writer and we have been proud to publish her work over her nearly eight years as our Washington Correspondent. We wish her the best," New York Magazine issued a statement which also said that Nuzzi was not biased in ger coverage of the 2024 campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy seeks 'gag' order on witnesses, lawyers: 'Inflammatory, extrajudicial statements'
item.description: ​“As the Court is aware, Mr. Combs has been the target of an unending stream of allegations by prospective witnesses and their counsel in the press,” Diddy's lawyers wrote. “These prospective witnesses and their lawyers have made numerous inflammatory extrajudicial statements aimed at assassinating Mr. Combs’s character in the press.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hezbollah says Israeli army intelligence base near Tel Aviv targeted
item.description: ​Hezbollah fighters launched "quality rockets" at "the Glilot base of the Military Intelligence Unit 8200 in the Tel Aviv suburbs," the group said on Monday adding the attack was "in defense of Lebanon," "in response to Israeli aggressions" and dedicated to their slain leader Hassan Nasrallah. ​The Israeli army said its forces were pummelling Hezbollah's financial arm, hitting more than two dozen targets including a bunker with tens of millions of dollars in cash and gold. The strikes since Sunday night mark an expansion of Israel's campaign against the Iran-backed group
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump explains why he's much ahead of Harris on Polymarket: 'They got to know her'
item.description: Donald Trump leads Kamala Harris by over 20 points on Polymarket, a decentralized prediction market. ​The Polymarket surge in favor of Donald Trump is reportedly manipulated. One of the four accounts on Polymarket that have fueled speculation over their large bets has taken even bigger wagers. The four top accounts on the cryptocurrency-prediction exchange are owned by non-Americans as Polymarket does not allow Americans to register.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mark Cuban wanted Elon Musk and Kamala Harris to be friends. Then this happened...
item.description: ​"100%. Yeah, for sure. Why not? Look, she's been very clear—she's going to work with Republicans. She's not an ideologue, and that's key. She talks about it all the time. She wants to be a problem-solver. She's open-minded and willing to collaborate," Cuban said as he finally gave the answer to whether Kamala Harris will work with Elon Musk if she wins the election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
